name: TOI-270
scenarioDescription:
The TOI-270 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-270 is a star with 0.4 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.38 times its radius. It is located 73.22 light years away from the solar system.

TOI-270 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-270 system


TOI-270 b

TOI-270 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of TOI-270 b is 1.247 that of Earth.


TOI-270 c

TOI-270 c was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of TOI-270 c is 2.42 that of Earth.


TOI-270 d

TOI-270 d was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of TOI-270 d is 2.13 that of Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system TOI-270, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
